main event: Observers in El Paso, Texas, reported a sighting of a cigar-shaped unidentified aerial object on April 15, 1949. The object initially appeared rectangular and then became convex before disintegrating and disappearing after approximately 15 minutes of observation.
interesting points: The object was initially observed at an altitude of 7,000-8,000 feet and at an angle of 30Â° above the horizon.
It appeared to be about 50 feet long, slender, and had a light smoke color.
The object made maneuvers such as turning horizontally and elongating before disappearing.
No sound, odor, or trail was reported, and no clouds were present near the object at the time of the sighting.
Observers described the sighting as clear and bright with unlimited visibility.
witnesses: Civilian observer, USAF personnel, Housewife, Branch Manager
